sentences.sContent: First a house took a direct hit and then the rocket exploded.
sentences.sCn: 首先一幢房子被直接击中，接着火箭弹爆炸了。

sentences.sContent: ...smaller fast-food chains in America have been hit particularly hard in this downturn because they are competing with the global giant McDonald's...
...much has been said about him as a peerless business leader who  has created immense wealth for shareholders, and guided the design of hit products that are transforming entire industries...
...You don't have to hit the grocery store daily...
...A true leader is someone who develops his or her team so that they can and do hit their targets and achieve their goals...
...likens the crisis to the downturn that hit his business after September 11th...
...the tree because he was trying not to hit a box that had fallen off the truck ahead of him...
...Mclaughlin turned right on main street and 33rd street and hit Volkswagen rabbit...

synos.tran: 打击；袭击；碰撞；偶然发现；伤…的感情
打；打击；（演出等）成功；讽刺

phrases.pCn: 使受到沉重的打击，使…遭受严重的挫折
打中目标；达到目的；成功
使人满足；正合需要；恰到好处
成为新闻头条；被大肆宣传
严重打击；大力击球；坠入情网；（美口）经济上的破产
